span.a: Anti-Bullying Resources for Parents and Teachers

div.p: Okmulgee Public Schools Annual Notification of Nondiscrimination

Okmulgee Public Schools do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, or age in its programs and activities. For information regarding this policy, please contact the following persons: Assistant Superintendent of Programs, 316 East 8th Street Okmulgee, OK 74447; 918-758-2000

Each recipient of a grant or subgrant under the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6301 et seq.) must display, in a public place, the hotline contact information of the Office of Inspector General of the Department of Education so that any individual who observes, detects, or suspects improper use of taxpayer funds can easily report such improper use. ESSA. Section 9203(1). 1-800-647-8733
